Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Bulgarian 1.1
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Bulgarian was built with CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the CoNLL2017 word embeddings. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~96.8.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Croatian 1.2
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~94.1.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Croatian 1.0
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, the RAPUT corpus and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.hr word embeddings. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~95.11.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: Czech Models (MorfFlex CZ 161115 + PDT 3.0) for MorphoDiTa 161115
Description: These models were developed for MorphoDiTa, which performs morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging (see also the PoS-taggers and lemmatizers Resource Family). The morphological dictionary is created from the 161115 version of the MorfFlex CZ lexicon and the 1.2 version of the DeriNet lexical network. The PoS tagger is trained on Prague Dependency Treebank 3.0.#SEPThe models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

This model is trained using RobeCzech, which is the Czech version of BERT. The model is trained on the Prague Dependency Treebank 3.5.#SEPThe model is available for download from the LINDAT repository.

These models are for MorphoDiTa, which performs morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging (see also the PoS-taggers and lemmatizers Resource Family).#SEPThe morphological dictionary is created from Morphium and SCOWL (Spell Checker Oriented Word Lists), the PoS tagger is trained on the Wall Street Journal.
This BERT model can be fine-tuned to achieve state-of-the-art results for various Finnish natural language processing tasks.#SEPThe model is available for download from the Language Bank of Finland.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Macedonian 1.1
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Macedonian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the 1984 training corpus (to be published) and using the Macedonian CLARIN.SI word embeddings. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~97.6.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.
This is a model for the Liner2.5 tool for the recognition of verbs without explicit subjects.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN-PL repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Serbian 1.2
Description: The model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~95.2.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Serbian 1.0
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, the hr500k training corpus and the RAPUT corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sr word embeddings. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~94.91.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

These are Slovak models for MorphoDiTa, a tool which provides morphological analysis, morphological generation and part-of-speech tagging. The morphological dictionary is created from MorfFlex (SK 170914) and the PoS tagger is trained on automatic translations in Prague Dependency Treebank 3.0.#SEPThe models are available for download from the LINDAT repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Slovenian 1.3
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~97.06.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Slovenian 1.0
Description: This model for morphosyntactic annotation of non-standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and the Janes-Tag corpus, using the CLARIN.SI-embed.sl word embeddings. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The model simultaneously produces UPOS, FEATS and XPOS (MULTEXT-East) labels. The estimated F1 of the XPOS annotations is ~96.14.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

This is a set of 2 models. flair_eval is trained on SUC3 with Talbanken_SBX_devas dev set. The advantage of this model is that it can be evaluated, using Talbanken_SBX_test or SIC2. flair_full is trained on SUC3, Talbanken_SBX_test, SIC2 with Talbanken_SBX_dev as dev set.#SEPThe models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

This is a set of 2 models. marmot_eval is trained on SUC3 and the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank, using Saldo as dictionary. marmot_full is trained on SUC3, the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank, and SIC2 (with Saldo as dictionary).#SEPThe models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.

This is a set of 2 models. stanza_eval is trained on SUC3 and the Talbanken_SBX_dev treebank. stanza_full is trained on the SUC3, Talbanken_SBX_test, and SIC2 sets, with Talbanken_SBX_dev as dev set.#SEPThe models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.
